bug.author: mshalvagal
bug.summary: [Bug] Solarize transform breaks with cuda input tensors
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Solarize doesn't seem to perform a check for being on the same device as the input tensor, and always keeps the addition and threshold parameters on the cpu. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: import torch from kornia import augmentation as augs augmentor = augs.RandomSolarize(0.5,0.1) x = torch.randn([64, 3, 32, 32]).to('cuda:0') augmentor(x) <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Error message (last call only): <denchmark-code>File "<venv path>/lib/python3.6/site-packages/kornia/enhance/adjust.py", line 300, in solarize input = input + additions RuntimeError: Expected all tensors to be on the same device, but found at least two devices, cuda:0 and cpu! </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
PyTorch version: 1.6.0 Is debug build: No CUDA used to build PyTorch: 10.2 OS: Ubuntu 18.04.5 LTS GCC version: (Ubuntu 7.5.0-3ubuntu1~18.04) 7.5.0 Clang version: Could not collect CMake version: version 3.10.2 Python version: 3.6 (64-bit runtime) Is CUDA available: Yes CUDA runtime version: 10.0.130 GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: Quadro RTX 5000 Nvidia driver version: 440.100 cuDNN version: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7.6.5 Versions of relevant libraries: [pip3] numpy==1.19.1 [pip3] torch==1.6.0 [pip3] torchvision==0.7.0 [conda] Could not collect
